situation.title: Visits to social facilities
situation.meta_description: Visits in any social service providers' facilities, retirement homes, homes with special arrangements, and any respite care social services in the residential form are prohibited.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Visits to the facilities of homes for the elderly and homes with a special regime and all relief social services in the residential form are possible. However, the visit must meet the conditions of one of the following options:

  • Before the visit, undergo a POC test for the presence of SARS CoV-2 virus antigen directly at the facility you want to visit, with a negative result.
  • Pass the test for the presence of SARS-CoV-2 virus by RT-PCR with a negative result, no later than 48 hours before the start of the visit and prove this by proof of this examination.
  • Prove that she had contracted covid-19 in the period of not more than 90 days before the date of the visit.

During the visit, it is necessary to observe all internal regime measures of the given sanitary facility.

The visitor must also wear mouth and nose protection at all times, at least a respirator of class FFP2 or KN95 without an exhalation valve (the veil is therefore considered insufficient).

Remember that you are entering a facility where there is a high concentration of people prone to a worse course of covid-19. Please be extremely considerate when visiting.

Walk

The client who will move during the walk outside the premises of the social services facility must, upon returning to the facility, undergo the following:

  • He/she, immediately upon return, will be placed in preventive quarantine.
  • He/she will undergo an antigenic POC test, within 72 hours of returning which will be once repeated for another 3 to 4 days.
  • If both of these tests are negative, the quarantine will be terminated.

During the walk, the client of the social service facility must use a respirator of at least class FFP2 or KN95 (N 95) (the veil is therefore considered insufficient).
